DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma Pathologic M CPTAC Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for head and neck cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma Pathologic Distant Metastasis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas._A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Property.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck Pathologic Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v8

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/2/21 jk upd to use C12418 as OC for consistency with NCI Std TNM.  6/23/21 jk created for CPTAC HNSCC Baseline CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A national effort to accelerate the understanding of the molecular basis of cancer through the application of large-scale proteome and genome analysis, or proteogenomics._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No Pathologic Evidence of Distant Metastasis
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A result that there is no pathologic evidence of distant metastasis.

Concepts.definition: A result that there is no pathologic evidence of distant metastasis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lack of clinical and/or pathology information to assign a pM stage conclusively.
